SOS: .39
Stadium: Ford Field
Principal Owner: Sheila Ford Hamp
General Manager/Executive VP: Brad Holmes
Offensive Scheme: Erhardt-Perkins
Defensive Alignment: 3-4

The Lions' Bye Week occurs in Week 9 (Sunday, Nov. 5). The League's three-game preseason schedule features the Lions hosting the New York Giants in Week 1, a home game against the Jacksonville Jaguars in Week 2 and a road contest against the Carolina Panthers in Week 3.Â
FLEXIBLE SCHEDULING
This season, "flexible scheduling" for Sunday Night Football may be used up to twice between Weeks 5-10, and in the NFL's discretion during Weeks 11-17; and for Monday Night Football in the NFL's discretion in Weeks 12-17.ÂDuring the Flex Scheduling Windows, the games initially scheduled for Sunday Night Football (on NBC) and Monday Night Football (on ESPN or ABC) are tentatively scheduled and subject to change.ÂOnly Sunday afternoon games (or those listed as TBD) are eligible to be moved to Sunday night or Monday night, in which case the initially scheduled Sunday/Monday night game would be moved to Sunday afternoon.ÂSunday afternoon games may also be moved between 1:00 p.m. and 4:05 p.m. or 4:25 p.m. ET.ÂAs in prior seasons, for Week 18, the final weekend of the season, the scheduling of the Saturday, Sunday afternoon, and the Sunday night games is not assigned.ÂIn Week 18, two games will be played on Saturday (4:30 PM ET and 8:15 PM ET) with the remainder to be played on
